title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley stuns in navy dress with husband Tom Pitford at Specsavers event
text:
She's been showing off her incredible footwork alongside pro Johannes Radebe during her stint on Strictly Come Dancing.

But Catherine Tyldesley enjoyed a brief break from her gruelling rehearsals as she attended Specsavers' Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards with husband Tom Pitford at 8 Northumberland Avenue in London on Tuesday evening.

The former Coronation Street star, 36 - who shares son Alfie, four, with the gym instructor, 33 - ensured all eyes were on her as she slipped into a sleek navy dress while sporting a pair of square-framed reading glasses.

Date night: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley enjoyed a break from rehearsals at the Specsavers' Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards with husband Tom Pitford in London on Tuesday

Actress Catherine looked sensational in her dark blue ensemble, which featured retro shoulder pads and flared sleeves.

Upping the style ante, the media personality boosted her physique in a pair of metallic ankle-strap heels, which coordinated with her glossy clutch.

The Scarborough star added a hint of sparkle into her appearance as she accessorised with bedazzled dangle earrings.

With her chocolate-coloured locks dressed into loose waves, the Salford native highlighted her beauty with shimmery red eyeshadow and dewy foundation.

Fitness enthusiast Tom opted for an equally stylish display as he donned a sharp shirt, straight-leg trousers and brown leather boots.

Last week, actress Catherine wowed with her 'best dance yet' as she performed a sultry Rumba alongside professional dancer Johannes, 32.

Judge Shirley Ballas was left teary-eyed after the TV star finished her routine, gushing: 'I'm actually a little bit overwhelmed because normally rumbas at this time of the year makes me cringe but that was absolutely beautiful.'

Off they go: Catherine and her partner, 33, held onto their goodie bags as they departed from the event

Home time! The couple - who tied the knot in 2016 - hopped into a black taxi as they headed home following a long night

While Craig Revel Horwood had some criticisms of the performance, he did admitted that it was her best dance, and she was 'absolutely stunning' on the dancefloor.

The dancing pair were rewarded with 32 points out of 40, coming fourth on the leader board.

Catherine has come on leaps and bounds since her first performance, where they scored a combined score of 19.
